bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A nomination for local government office must be in writing and must include the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the full name of the person nominated;
the usual name of the person nominated, if the full name of the person is different from the name the person usually uses and the person wishes to have his or her usual name on the ballot instead;

a statement signed by the nominators that, to the best of their knowledge, the person nominated is qualified under section 81 [who may hold office on a local government] to be nominated;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a nomination to be accepted for filing, a nomination must be accompanied by the following:

as applicable, a signed declaration of the person nominated

identifying the person who is appointed under the Local Elections Campaign Financing Act to act as financial agent for the person nominated;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the written disclosure required by section 2 (1) of the Financial Disclosure Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2) (b), the person nominated must make a solemn declaration

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that he or she is qualified under section 81 to be nominated for the office,

that the person

understands the requirements and restrictions that apply to the person under that Act, and
intends to fully comply with those requirements and restrictions.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions in relation to this Division
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Division:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: commercial vehicle means a vehicle used by a person on a highway in a participating municipality, if the vehicle is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a commercial vehicle as defined by and licensed under the Commercial Transport Act,
a passenger directed vehicle, as defined in the Passenger Transportation Act, that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is not licensed as referred to in paragraph (a), and
is prescribed for the purposes of this definition, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a vehicle not licensed as referred to in paragraph (a) but used for the collection or delivery, or both, of merchandise or another commodity in the ordinary course of a business;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: licence year means a calendar year;
municipality includes the City of Vancouver;
participating municipality means a municipality in which a bylaw is in force declaring that this Division applies in the municipality.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Despite any other Act relating to a municipality, this Division applies to all municipalities.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A council may, by bylaw, declare that this Division applies to the municipality, and in that case it applies in the municipality from and after the start of the licence year that begins at least 3 months after the adoption of the bylaw.
A bylaw under subsection (1) must make provision not inconsistent with this Division for the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the imposition and collection of licence fees;
the issue of licences and licence plates;
the transfer of licences and licence plates, and transfer fees.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A bylaw under subsection (1) may be repealed or amended at any time, but a repeal does not take effect until the end of the licence year in which the repealing bylaw is adopted.
A municipality that is not a participating municipality may not impose a licence fee under this Division or issue a class of licence under this Division.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The following commercial vehicles are exempt from this Division:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a commercial vehicle owned by the Provincial government;
a commercial vehicle owned and operated by an improvement district;

a commercial vehicle licensed as a farm vehicle under the Commercial Transport Act, except when used for the collection or delivery, or both, of merchandise or another commodity not required in the ordinary course of the farm undertaking of the owner of the vehicle;

a commercial vehicle licensed under the Commercial Transport Act that is owned by a farmer and used only to transport the produce of the farmer's farm to market and to transport supplies required for the farmer's farm;
a commercial vehicle licensed under the Commercial Transport Act that is not being used by a person for the purpose of the person's business or by an organization for profit;
a commercial vehicle not requiring a licence fee under section 3 (8) [disabled war veterans] of the Motor Vehicle Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless exempted under section 631, a commercial vehicle must not be operated on a highway in a participating municipality unless there is displayed on the vehicle a valid and subsisting licence plate issued in accordance with this Division for the vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Issue and transfer of licence plates

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On application for a licence under this Division for a commercial vehicle and payment of the licence fee, a licence plate must be issued for the vehicle.

On application for a licence under this Division for a commercial vehicle operated under an agreement under section 10 [agreements with other governments respecting prorating of fees and reciprocity] of the Commercial Transport Act and payment of the licence fee, a licence plate must be issued and is valid for display on any commercial vehicle operated under the agreement.
Subject to the requirements of a bylaw under this Division, a licence plate may be transferred

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: from one person to another person for the same commercial vehicle, or
from one commercial vehicle to another commercial vehicle for the same person,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: on payment of the prescribed fee, together with any amount representing the difference in licence fee required for the transfer of a licence plate to a commercial vehicle of greater gross vehicle weight.

The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations prescribing fees for the purposes of this section and, in relation to fees under subsections (1) and (2), may prescribe different fees for commercial vehicles of different gross vehicle weight.
For the purposes of section 635 [fees to be paid to UBCM], an amount paid under subsection (3) of this section in addition to the prescribed fee is deemed to be a licence fee.
A licence issued under this Division by a municipality is valid in every municipality for the current licence year.
A licence issued during November or December must be issued for the following licence year and is a valid and subsisting licence from the date of issue until the end of the following licence year.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fees to be paid to UBCM

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: After deducting any licence transfer fee under section 633 (3) and the prescribed administration fee, a municipality must pay the remainder of the fees it collects under this Division to the Union of British Columbia Municipalities.
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations prescribing administration fees for the purposes of subsection (1).

Money received by the Union of British Columbia Municipalities under subsection (1) must be placed in a separate licence fee account, and the money may be paid out of the account for any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: licence plate production expenses;
the expenses of conducting the audit under subsection (4);
other related expenses;
payments to participating municipalities.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The licence fee account must be audited at the times and in the manner directed by the minister.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Offences in relation to commercial vehicle licensing

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The owner or operator of a commercial vehicle, other than a vehicle exempted under section 631 [exemptions from licensing requirements], who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: operates or uses the vehicle, or
causes the vehicle to be operated or used

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: on a highway in a participating municipality without holding and displaying a valid and subsisting licence plate for the vehicle is liable on conviction to a fine not exceeding $50.

A person who displays or causes to be displayed a licence plate on a commercial vehicle not authorized to have it displayed on the vehicle is liable on conviction to a fine not exceeding $200 and the confiscation of the licence plate.
A fine imposed under this section does not remove any liability for a prescribed licence fee under this Division.
